entries.title: China's plans to scrap Covid quarantine rules is a win for key Club holdings
entries.description: China's latest move to roll back its zero-Covid policy by scrapping quarantine restrictions for travelers is the last leg of recovery we've been waiting for.

entries.title: Tesla's stock is headed for its worst month, quarter and year on record
entries.description: Tesla shares slid 9% on Tuesday with investors continuing to flee the electric vehicle maker and CEO Elon Musk.

entries.title: 3 signs the 'pandemic economy' ended in 2022—even though Covid is still around
entries.description: The Covid-19 pandemic changed a number of Americans' money habits. But not all of those changes were built to last.

entries.title: The benefits and risks of using a password manager to protect your online identity
entries.description: Consumers with password managers are less likely to experience identity theft, but choosing an online identity protection service requires some thought.

entries.title: Stop complaining, says billionaire investor Charlie Munger: 'Everybody's five times better off than they used to be'
entries.description: The billionaire investor can't understand why people today aren't more content with what they have, especially after the struggles of previous generations.

entries.title: Chinese EV maker Nio cuts delivery guidance for fourth quarter, citing Covid disruptions
entries.description: Nio had expected to deliver up to 48,000 EVs in the fourth quarter, but Covid-linked supply chain issues pushed the Chinese company to cut its guidance.

entries.title: New sanctions starting to bite Russia's economy as Moscow admits deficit impact
entries.description: The latest round of Western sanctions against Russia over its invasion of Ukraine are beginning to pinch the country's economy, economists have suggested.

entries.title: Chinese provinces hit hard by Covid are seeing a strain on critical care, health officials say
entries.description: Some Chinese provinces' intensive care beds and resources are nearing capacity as Covid-19 infections soar, national health authorities said Tuesday.

entries.title: China turns to lemons, peaches and traditional medicine in wake of Covid wave
entries.description: Covid cases in China saw a spike following the country's relaxation of strict Covid rules - but so are the prices of TCM and certain fruits.

entries.title: Here are the countries Chinese tourists want to visit the most
entries.description: Now that China is set to reopen its borders, locals are rushing to plan overseas travel for the Lunar New Year in late January, according to Trip.com Group.

entries.title: Hit by climate change, farmers in Cambodia are risking everything on microfinance loans
entries.description: Crop failures from erratic weather and wildfires are leading farmers to take out loans to survive, with their land — and therefore livelihood — as collateral.

entries.title: Shares of China-based funeral company are surging as Covid infections spike
entries.description: Hong Kong-listed shares of China's biggest cemeteries operator and funeral service rose to their highest level in more than a year amid a brutal Covid wave.

entries.title: China to scrap quarantine for international travelers in an essential end of zero-Covid
entries.description: China announced Monday that starting Jan. 8, 2023, travelers will no longer need to quarantine upon arrival on the mainland.

entries.title: An Indian tech unicorn's founders share 3 tips for success — including a 'hit by a bus' plan
entries.description: The founders of sports tech start-up Dream Sports explain why workers who reach out to other employees during "unplug" time must pay a fine of about $1,200.
